item.title: Using JDBC FilteredRowSet - Simple Example
item.author: sklenar.pav@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: Pavel Sklenar
item.description: This post shows how to use a FilteredRowSet object. It lets you filter the number of rows that are visible in a RowSet object so that you can work with only the relevant data that you need. You may decide how you want to “filter” the data and apply that filter to a FilteredRowSet object. In other words, the FilteredRowSet object makes visible only the rows of data that fit within the limits you set.
